## Learning resources and links for starting out in coding for bioinformatics

Open terminal, practice exercises in Software carpentry: Unix command line https://swcarpentry.github.io/shell-novice/

Install R https://www.r-project.org/ and RStudio https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/

Practice exercises in Software carpentry: programming in R http://swcarpentry.github.io/r-novice-inflammation/  

Install the R packages in the tidyverse https://www.tidyverse.org/, explore making plots with ggplot2 https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/ 

Explore the R graph gallery website https://r-graph-gallery.com/

Start practicing the exercises in the R for Data Science book https://r4ds.had.co.nz/

Practice exercises in Hands-On Programming with R book https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/

Create a GitHub account and make your first repository https://github.com/

Begin using RMarkdown https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/ and create an R notebook for making simple plots https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/lesson-10.html
